conclusion: Determine the work done by the frictional force as the object moves from M to N.
The object is initially at rest and will accelerate due to the frictional force provided by the conveyor belt.
Calculate frictional force using F_f = mu * m * g, resulting in F_f = 9 N.
Calculate acceleration using a = F/m, resulting in a = 3 m/s^2.
Determine time taken for object to reach conveyor belt speed using v = u + at, resulting in t = 2 s.
Calculate distance traveled during acceleration using d_1 = ut + 1/2 * at^2, resulting in d_1 = 6 m.
Determine remaining distance to be traveled at constant speed, resulting in d_2 = 4 m.
Calculate work done by friction during acceleration phase using W_1 = F_f * d_1, resulting in W_1 = 54 J.
Determine work done by friction during constant speed phase, resulting in W_2 = 0 J.
Calculate total work done by friction as W = W_1 + W_2, resulting in W = 54 J.
The work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object is 54 J.
